description: Strategic AI for Leadership Intelligence plan (â‚¬199+). Long-horizon, decision-oriented insights for CEOs and Board members.
systemPrompt: You are a strategic organizational intelligence assistant. Your role is to help executive leadership understand structural patterns, systemic risks, and organizational trajectory. Focus on decisions that require leadership authority and have 60-120 day impact horizons. Synthesize across teams to reveal organizational-level dynamics.

narrative.summary: The organization is experiencing structural execution drag. While individual team health varies, cross-team coordination costs have increased 23% over 90 days. Meeting density is compressing decision cycles, and strategic initiatives are stalling at mid-management handoffs.
inflectionPoints: Week of Oct 15: Cross-functional meeting load exceeded sustainable threshold
Week of Nov 3: First signs of strategic initiative delays
Week of Dec 1: Attrition risk elevated in high-coordination roles

structuralRisks.risk: Decision authority is unclear across 40% of cross-functional initiatives
structuralRisks.costOfInaction: Strategic initiatives will continue to stall. Estimated 2-3 month delay on Q1 roadmap.

structuralRisks.risk: Meeting culture consuming 18% more capacity than 90 days ago with no governance
structuralRisks.costOfInaction: Erosion of deep work time will reduce output quality and increase burnout exposure.

leveragePoints.currentState: Cross-functional work requires 4.2 approvals on average. 60% of decisions involve >3 stakeholders.
leveragePoints.opportunity: Clarify decision authority at program level to eliminate coordination overhead
leveragePoints.expectedImpact: Reduce cross-team meeting load by 20-30%, accelerate initiative velocity
leveragePoints.decisionRequired: Should you move to RACI model, delegate more authority to program leads, or restructure around value streams?

leveragePoints.currentState: No organizational standard for recurring meetings. 35% have unclear outcomes.
leveragePoints.opportunity: Institute meeting governance framework with executive endorsement
leveragePoints.expectedImpact: Reclaim 10-15% of organizational capacity for execution
leveragePoints.decisionRequired: Will you mandate meeting standards top-down or pilot with leadership team first?

dragSources: Excessive coordination handoffs on cross-functional work
executionAnalysis.capacityUtilization: Organization is at 85% calendar saturation. Limited headroom for strategic work or unexpected demands.

decisionPrompts.question: Should you flatten decision-making or invest in program management capacity?
decisionPrompts.context: Coordination overhead is the primary execution drag. You can eliminate layers or add structure.
decisionPrompts.tradeoffs: Flattening speeds decisions but increases leadership load. PM investment adds cost but scales coordination.
decisionPrompts.timeframe: Decision needed within 30 days to impact Q1 planning

decisionPrompts.question: Will you treat meeting governance as a culture shift or a policy mandate?
decisionPrompts.context: Meeting load is unsustainable. Behavior change required organization-wide.
decisionPrompts.tradeoffs: Culture shift is slower but durable. Mandate is faster but requires enforcement.
decisionPrompts.timeframe: Decision needed within 14 days to implement before year-end planning

highRiskSegments: Individual contributors in high-coordination roles (18% of workforce)
Mid-level managers with >8 direct reports and cross-functional duties
structuralDrivers: Chronic meeting overload reducing work satisfaction
Unclear career paths for high-performing individual contributors
Execution drag creating frustration in high-agency employees
retentionExposure.interventionScope: Requires leadership decision on career frameworks and org design, not just manager coaching
